result.execSummary:
The defendant Uriel S Ramirez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court orders Mr. Ramirez to pay the balance due on court financial obligations within sixty days, or within that same time period he may set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office.  Non-payment will result in 30 days in Jail with Huber release consecutive.

On Counts #1 and #3 each the Court sentences Mr. Ramirez to:
--serve six months in Jefferson County Jail on each count concurrent; to commence forthwith (time served) 

--164 days credit for time already served is given

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Uriel S Ramirez

records.addlTxt: of Intent to Certify Debt to the WI Dept. of Revenue.

[MK] case called at 9:10am. 
Defendant Uriel S Ramirez in court, in custody, with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The maximum penalties are recited.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance.
Sentencing arguments are given by counsel. 

On Counts #1 and #3 each the Court sentences Mr. Ramirez to:
--serve six months in Jefferson County Jail on each count concurrent; to commence forthwith (time served) 
--164 days credit for time already served is given

The Court orders Mr. Ramirez to pay the balance due on court financial obligationswithin sixty days, or within that same time period he may set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. [As to the amount due the clerk lists the amount shown on the DOC Balance Inquiry form, writing on the payment slip:   $1,035.30 approximately (amount is to be finalized as calculated by the clerk).]  Non-payment will result in 30 days in Jail with Huber release consecutive.
recess 9:14am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 24, 2018 at 09:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 22, 2018 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Cases 15CT248 and 15CM103 called together at 10:06am [mo]
Defendant Uriel S Ramirez in court, in custody with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance; submits victim impact statement

The Court begins plea colloquy when it determines that 15CT248 is not listed in the plea paper; DA Happ indicates that a Disposition Stipulation was prepared for case 15CT248.
recess:10:11am -reconvene:10:12am (to allow Atty. Dahnert and Mr. Ramirez to review proposed disposition stipulation)

As to Case 15CT248(Scheduled for Adjourned Initial App. & Plea/Sent):
Atty. Dahnert submits signed Disposition Stipulation
The Court signs the Disposition Stipulation.
Atty. Dahnert requests a pay plan for Mr. Ramirez due to his custodial status and lack of employment at this time.
The Court grants Mr. Ramirez until 9/29/2015 to pay the amount due as set forth is the Disposition Stipulation, $236.00; alternative for non-payment is suspension of driving privileges, not to exceed 2 years.

As to Case 15CM103(Plea/Sent occurs):
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of "No Contest" entered on Counts #1 & #3; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Counts #1 & #3, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

--On Count #1: to serve 30 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release/Huber privileges for work , to commence 8/29/2015 at 6:00pm
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no possession of any dangerous weapons
--Complete certified Batterers' Intervention programming
--no acts or threats of violence
--On Count #1: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
 plus $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge
--On Count #3: to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge


Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess: 11:04am

Case called at 10:27 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Uriel S Ramirez in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert. ADA John E K Fryatt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Court continues $1500 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence towards any persons 
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Gloria Ramirez  
-Booking at JCSD 
Cash bond to be returned to surety
